attributes.action: Create equal pay, pensions and rights for all troops (and their spouses/children) serving in the armed forces irrespective of their commonwealth nationality/status.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Gurkha's are a proud people.
Better to die than be a coward" is their motto.
Since 1815, 13 Victoria Crosses have been won by their troops.
And yet after serving alongside other British-formed regiments, the pension payable on their return to Nepal is much lower than would be the case for their counterparts.
Widows and children of Gurkha's killed on active service also have no legal protection within the UK and may be deported if the worst happens to their kin.
This petition aim is to state that these issues are unnacceptable, and that legislation should be put forward to rectify this inadequacy as soon as is possible.
